explains: adj. 愉快而自信的；看涨的，保持高价的，繁荣的；（液体或气体）有浮力的；漂浮的，能够漂起的

sentences.en: Salt water is more buoyant than fresh water.
They must also keep swimming to keep from sinking, since most have largely or completely lost the swim bladder, the gas-filled sac that helps most other fish remain buoyant.
sentences.cn: 它们还必须不停地游动以避免下沉，因为大多数鱼基本上或完全失去了鱼鳔，这个充满气体的囊帮助大多数其他鱼保持浮力。

sentences.en: They were all in buoyant mood.
